author: bridge-bot
content:
<marcin_d_s> Analyzing of gas-benchmarks (the ones with fixed 100M gas blocks).

Plenty of data is missing, unfortunately, but there are many actions which can be done based on available data.

A few scenarios performing extremely badly (below 10MGas/s), to be checked by devs from Besu, Geth, Erigon and Ethrex.

For increasing block gas limit to 75M, we need all scenarios to perform at least 18.75 MGas/s (for 4s blocks; and would be good to have it at 25 MGas/s for 3s blocks). All scenarios performing under this requirement are marked red.

For the future we want all scenarios to perform at least 60 MGas/s. Slower ones are marked yellow.

On protocol level, based on this data, only Point Evaluation precompile is performing below 60 MGas/s. In all other scenarios there is at least one client performing above this threshold, so it is theoretically possible to optimize clients to process everything above 60 MGas/s (except point eval).

author: bridge-bot
content: <marcin_d_s> Link to doc for better visibility: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/137wrHKGXG4Hb4a3G1zICGl1U34AiNT3W9iEimrzxpXQ/edit?usp=sharing

Hey @marcin_d_s,
Related to empty cells on besu, is that related to this scenario 
```

~/fixtures/blockchain_tests/benchmark/compute/instruction/account_query/extcode_ops.json
```

I see that there is a first block that is really big, around ~180 GigaGas and then a second block with 100 mgas used to gather the metrics. The issue I see is that over http with newPayload, it could cause issues. Using blockchain tests I see that even with 2 Ggas/s, it is still taking 85 seconds to execute.
```
